units.title: Transfer tissue into Falcon tube
units.text: 1 Transfer each tissue sample (<3–4 cm3) into a separate 50-ml Falcon tube ﬁlled with D-BSA. Keep tissues on ice until starting the isolation.
units.rationale: Initial step to collect and keep tissue cold before processing.

units.title: Register sample in lab system
units.text: 2 Register the new sample in the corresponding lab management system.

units.title: Cut tissue into small pieces
units.text: 6 Aspirate the excess D-BSA and cut the tissue into small pieces (2–4 mm3) using two scalpels by holding one scalpel in each hand and slicing the tissue while pressing the blades of both scalpels against each other.
units.rationale: Creates uniformly sized fragments for efficient digestion.

units.title: Add collagenase and ROCK inhibitor
units.text: 17 Add 500 µl of collagenase (20 mg/ml stock, ﬁnal concentration 1 mg/ml) and 10 µl of ROCK inhibitor (10 mM stock, ﬁnal concentration 10 µM) to the 50-ml Falcon tube containing the minced tissue.
units.rationale: Introduces enzymes to dissociate tissue into cells.

units.title: Digest tissue on orbital shaker
units.text: 18 Wrap the 50-ml Falcon tube with Paraﬁlm and place the tube at a slight angle (~15°) on top of an orbital shaker located inside a heated incubator oven at 37 °C. Set the orbital shaker at 140 r.p.m. and digest the tissue for 1–2 h. At this moment, the processing of the next tissue can be initiated.
units.rationale: Provides controlled enzymatic digestion while maintaining temperature.

units.title: Monitor digestion and pipette periodically
units.text: 19 Pipette up and down 5–10 times every 30 min using a 5-ml sterile serological pipette pre-wetted with D-BSA medium to aid digestion. Monitor the digestion of the tissue at least every 30 min, using an inverted bright‑field microscope (×5, ×10 or ×20 objective). When clusters of 5–10 cells are observed (Fig. 2g), digestion is complete.
units.rationale: Ensures digestion proceeds to the desired cell cluster size.

units.title: Stop collagenase digestion with FBS
units.text: 20 After incubation, take the tube from the heated incubator oven and clean with 70% EtOH. Add 1 ml of FBS directly to the 50-ml Falcon tube to stop the collagenase digestion.
units.rationale: Neutralizes enzyme activity to preserve cell viability.

units.title: Strain digested tissue through 100‑µm filter
units.text: 22 Pre‑wet a 100‑µm strainer by pipetting 10 ml of D‑BSA on the strainer into a new 50‑ml Falcon tube. Swirl the 50‑ml tube to wet the sides of the tube and discard the D‑BSA. Then, strain the digested tissue over the 100‑µm strainer into the 50‑ml Falcon tube (both pre‑wetted with D‑BSA).
units.rationale: Removes large debris and aggregates before centrifugation.

units.title: Centrifuge flow‑through to collect cells
units.text: 27 Centrifuge the ﬂow‑through from Steps 22–26 at 450g for 5 min at 8 °C.
units.rationale: Pellets cells for subsequent washing and resuspension.

units.title: Resuspend pellet in BME and plate drops
units.text: 34 Resuspend the pellet in an appropriate amount of BME. As a guideline, 200 µl is sufﬁcient for a pellet of ~50 µl. The amount of BME to add scales linearly with the pellet volume. 35 Plate 100 µl of BME‑containing cells in multiple small drops (<20 µl each) per well in a 12‑well plate (Fig. 2e). When tissue yield is limited, plating can be scaled down to 24‑well format by adapting all volumes accordingly (Table 3).
units.rationale: Embeds cells in matrix and distributes them for organoid formation.
